snippet: Sales prices in Manhattan for luxury residences are climbing toward $100 million, and some say it’s because buyers are looking at the properties as art.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column notes that home sale prices for luxury residences in Manhattan are climbing toward $100 million, phenomenon that some insiders say is caused by a growing sense that such apartments are works of art.
lead_paragraph: Sales prices in Manhattan for luxury residences are climbing toward $100 million, and some say it’s because buyers are looking at the properties as art.

headline.print_headline: Overpriced Real Estate? Well, Maybe It’s Art
headline.seo: Prices for Luxury Real Estate Keep Rising. It Must Be Art.
headline.main: Overpriced Real Estate? Well, Maybe It’s Art
